class.name: RenderingEngineND
class.brief_description: Abstract base class for ND rendering engines.
class.description: RenderingEngineND provides an interface for implementing ND renderers. It is an abstract base class, so it must be extended to be used. Rendering engines must be registered with [RenderingServerND] to be used. In comparison to Godot's rendering architecture, this is the ND equivalent of RendererScene (not exposed). Godot's RendererScene is named "scene" to distinguish 3D scene rendering from 2D canvas rendering, but for ND we do not need to distinguish from canvas rendering, and so we call this "rendering engine" for naming parity with physics engines. [b]Note:[/b] All of the properties in this class will be overwritten by [RenderingServerND] each frame. Modifying them will have no external effect.

method.name: _cleanup_for_viewport
method.description: Callback method to clean up the rendering engine for a viewport. This method is called by [RenderingServerND] once per viewport when it tries to render a frame with a different rendering engine than the one that was previously set up for that viewport. This is called before [method _setup_for_viewport] is called for the new rendering engine for that viewport.

method.name: _get_friendly_name
method.description: Returns the unique friendly name of the rendering engine. This is used by [RenderingServerND] to identify the rendering engine for a viewport, and is displayed in the editor. It should be a short, human-readable name that describes the rendering engine. This MUST be unique across all registered rendering engines.

method.name: _render_frame
method.description: Callback method to render a frame. This method is called by [RenderingServerND] every frame. The current camera, all meshes, and their transforms are passed in.

method.name: _setup_for_viewport
method.description: Callback method to set up the rendering engine for a viewport. This method is called by [RenderingServerND] once per viewport before calling [method _render_frame] for the first time for that viewport. In this function, only [member viewport] may be accessed. All other properties must not be accessed inside this function as they may contain stale data from other viewports or be null/empty.

members.member: The [CameraND] node currently being rendered by the rendering engine. This will be set by [RenderingServerND] before calling [method _render_frame].

An array of visible [MeshInstanceND] nodes to be rendered by the rendering engine. This will be set by [RenderingServerND] before calling [method _render_frame]. The size of this array will match the size of the [member mesh_relative_transforms] array, and each index of each array will correspond to the mesh at that index.

The mesh transform relative to the camera. This will be set by [RenderingServerND] before calling [method _render_frame]. The size of this array will match the size of the [member mesh_instances] array, and each index of each array will correspond to the mesh at that index.
The [Viewport] that the rendering engine is rendering to. This will be set by [RenderingServerND] before calling [method _setup_for_viewport].
